27 QNode::QNode(int argc, char** argv ) :
28  init_argc(argc),

32 QNode::~QNode() {
33  if(ros::isStarted()) {
34  ros::shutdown(); // explicitly needed since we use ros::start();
35  ros::waitForShutdown();
36  }
37  wait();
38 }
39 
40 bool QNode::init() {
41  ros::init(init_argc,init_argv,"qt_filter_tester");
42  if ( ! ros::master::check() ) {
43  return false;
44  }
45  ros::start(); // explicitly needed since our nodehandle is going out of scope.
46  ros::NodeHandle n;
47  // Add your ros communications here.
48  start();
49  return true;
50 }
51 
52 bool QNode::init(const std::string &master_url, const std::string &host_url) {
53  std::map<std::string,std::string> remappings;
54  remappings["__master"] = master_url;
55  remappings["__hostname"] = host_url;
56  ros::init(remappings,"qt_filter_tester");
57  if ( ! ros::master::check() ) {
58  return false;
59  }
60  ros::start(); // explicitly needed since our nodehandle is going out of scope.
61  ros::NodeHandle n;
62  // Add your ros communications here.
63  start();
64  return true;
65 }
66 
67 void QNode::run() {
68  ros::Rate loop_rate(1);
69  while ( ros::ok() ) {
70  ros::spinOnce();
71  loop_rate.sleep();
72  }
73  Q_EMIT rosShutdown(); // used to signal the gui for a shutdown (useful to roslaunch)
74 }
75 }
